name: Transparent Hands USA
mission: Conduct free life-saving surgeries/medical treatments for poor people all across Pakistan through its transparent crowdfunding online healthcare platform.
theoryOfChange: By using a transparent crowdfunding model, the organization connects global donors directly to verified patient cases to fund life-saving medical interventions that the local public health system or personal finances cannot cover.

grantsData.purpose: SURGERIES OF POOR PATIENTS IN PAKISTAN

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 36/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC earns 74/100 due to strong impact and strong alignment, with zakat compliance.

all_citations.claim: The charity has a score of 89.75/100 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.23 per $1 raised.
Total revenue was $584,685 with a program expense ratio of 72.0%.
The organization offers donation options that are Zakat-eligible.
The charity provides direct medical interventions such as heart surgeries for specific patients.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial accountability and direct impact on global health, though its limited working capital suggests a need for greater liquid reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Limited working capital of only 1.0 months
Reliance on a direct service model with a high cost per beneficiary

dimension_explanations.alignment: This organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors as it is Zakat-eligible and addresses the urgent global health needs of underserved communities in Pakistan [3]. Its fundraising efficiency of $0.23 per $1 raised reflects a focused effort on resource mobilization for its mission [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates high impact through direct service delivery, allocating 72.0% of its $584,685 revenue directly to surgical and medical programs [1][2]. While the cost per beneficiary is relatively high, the intervention provides life-altering medical procedures that are otherwise inaccessible to the target population [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC provides life-saving surgical and medical treatments to impoverished patients in Pakistan through a transparent crowdfunding platform.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 72.0% dedicated to medical services
Strong Charity Navigator score of 89.75/100 indicating solid accountability
Zakat-eligible status for donors seeking Sharia-compliant giving options
baseline_narrative.summary: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC works with numerous hospitals across Pakistan to facilitate free surgeries and medical procedures for those in need [1]. The organization reported a total revenue of $584,685 and maintains a high level of transparency regarding its medical programs [2].

all_citations.quote: Transparent Hands provides free surgeries and medical treatments to the underprivileged.

all_citations.claim: Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid
overall score of 89.89.75/100 from Charity Navigator

all_citations.quote: Zakat-eligible medical procedures for the poor.

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial accountability and direct impact on global health, though its limited working capital suggests a need for greater liquid reserves.

areas_for_improvement.context: The charity currently holds only <cite id="13">1.0 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, which may limit its ability to respond to sudden medical emergencies or revenue fluctuations.
With a <cite id="14">board size of only 3 members</cite>, the organization lacks the diversity of oversight typically found in larger institutions.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization maintains high transparency and accountability standards consistent with major evaluators.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains a high program ratio despite revenue fluctuations, showing a commitment to patient care over administrative growth.
risk_factors: <cite id="25">Low working capital ratio</cite> of 1.0 months
<cite id="26">Small board size</cite> limiting oversight breadth
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve financial volatility and governance scale: <cite id="24">revenue has declined by -11.9%</cite> over the last three years.

confidence.data_freshness: Data from 2023 Form 990 and 2024 Charity Navigator updates
confidence.notes: Strong transparency makes this a reliable evaluation despite small organizational size.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors with <cite id="22">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on the 'fuqara' (poor) asnaf in Pakistan.
alignment.improvement: The organization could <cite id="23">expand services to more underserved regions</cite> within Pakistan to increase its alignment with the most marginalized populations.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="17">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and high accountability scores. It also maintains <cite id="18">independent board oversight of 66%</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity should <cite id="19">expand its board of directors</cite> beyond the current three members to enhance governance oversight.

impact.explanation: Operations show a <cite id="20">72.0% program expense ratio</cite> with a direct service delivery model that provides life-saving surgeries.
impact.improvement: Impact sustainability would benefit from <cite id="21">building working capital reserves</cite> to 1-1.0 months of working capital.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Outcome tracking through Candid and patient reporting

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Funds its primary implementing partner in Pakistan to deliver medical services.

rich_narrative.headline: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC provides life-saving surgical and medical treatments to impoverished patients in Pakistan through a transparent crowdfunding platform.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value radical transparency and want to see the direct medical impact of their zakat or sadaqah on specific, named individuals in Pakistan.
donor_motivations: Want to fund specific surgeries with clear outcomes
Care about the healthcare crisis in Pakistan
giving_considerations: Donations fund high-cost individual procedures rather than broad public health policy
The organization is currently in a revenue contraction phase
Small-scale governance means a more personal but less institutional feel
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking large-scale systemic healthcare reform or those who prefer organizations with massive financial reserves.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The charity tracks <cite id="28">specific outcome metrics</cite> and maintains a documented theory of change, though large-scale independent RCTs are not present.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: By providing free surgical care to those below the poverty line, the charity prevents medical bankruptcy and restores the economic productivity of families.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that surgical interventions are successful and that patients receive the necessary follow-up care.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The organization has a <cite id="29">significant funding gap</cite> and a long waiting list of patients requiring life-saving surgeries.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="27">crowdfunding model</cite> which provides 100% transparency for individual surgical cases.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains an <cite id="8">Accountability & Finance score of 89/100</cite> from Charity Navigator, reflecting robust internal controls.
Transparent Hands directs a <cite id="9">program expense ratio of 72.0%</cite> toward medical services, ensuring the majority of funds reach patients.
The charity demonstrates high efficiency, spending only <cite id="10">$0.23 to raise every $1</cite> in donations.

strengths_deep_dive: Transparent Hands excels in organizational culture and leadership, receiving <cite id="11">perfect scores of 100/100 in both Culture & Community and Leadership & Adaptability</cite> from Charity Navigator. This indicates a healthy internal environment and a clear strategic vision. Furthermore, the organization has received prestigious recognition for its work, including the <cite id="12">Tamgha-e-Imtiaz from the Government of Pakistan</cite> and an International CSR award, validating its impact on a national and international scale.
rich_narrative.summary: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC operates as a specialized crowdfunding platform dedicated to providing <cite id="1">free surgeries and medical treatments</cite> to impoverished patients in Pakistan. By partnering with a network of private hospitals, the organization facilitates complex procedures including <cite id="2">cochlear implants, cardiac surgeries, and orthopedic interventions</cite> for those who cannot afford private healthcare. The organization maintains a <cite id="3">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting a high level of disclosure regarding its operations and outcomes. Financially, the charity reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $584,685</cite> in the 2023 tax year, with a significant portion of its funding derived from <cite id="5">individual contributions totaling $584,444</cite>. The model is built on transparency, allowing donors to see the specific patient their funds are supporting, which has earned the organization an <cite id="6">overall score of 89.89.75/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. Beyond surgical interventions, the foundation conducts <cite id="7">free medical camps and preventive healthcare sessions</cite> to address immediate health needs in rural and underserved areas of Pakistan. This dual approach of emergency surgical care and community-based medical camps ensures a broad impact on the healthcare landscape of the region.
